cab.content: (This Document l& the Property ofn/cn \ \ Hit Britannic NSaJe3ty's Government)Circulated by the Secretary of State for India. SECRET.From Viceroy, Foreign Department, 22nd October 1917. (Received 11.30 p.m.)Secret. Weekly report. All quiet throughout North-West Frontier. Chitral reliefs effected satisfactorily. No fresh disturbances reported from Bihar and Orissa, and troops are being gradually withdrawn although some will remain until a Muharum interruption over. Recruiting totals for September are 20,161 fighting men, 3,756 muleteers and 10,236 non-com-batants. No change in the general military situation in India or Afghanistan.
